pr_title: Issue #8306: Javadoc Modification for Metadata Generation Support - 1

timeline.body:
`{@code com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.TreeWalker}`

as it is javadoc and type is real, lets have good link in javadoc html files.

{@code com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.TreeWalker}

timeline.author: romani

timeline.body:
javadoc is  class descrition, we have to be exact on this level.
It might be weird, but we need real type in setter so - `int[]`.

metadata generator and xdoc generator will make it subsetOfTokenTypes as it is very special property. The same will be for all other special types.
timeline.bodyText:
javadoc is  class descrition, we have to be exact on this level.
It might be weird, but we need real type in setter so - int[].
metadata generator and xdoc generator will make it subsetOfTokenTypes as it is very special property. The same will be for all other special types.

timeline.author: romani
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -60,15 +60,18 @@ *
    *
  • * Property {@code max} - Specify the maximum threshold allowed. + * Type is {@code int}. * Default value is {@code 10}. *
    • *
  • * Property {@code switchBlockAsSingleDecisionPoint} - Control whether to treat * the whole switch block as a single decision point. + * Type is {@code boolean}. * Default value is {@code false}. *
    • *
  • * Property {@code tokens} - tokens to check + * Type is {@code subsetOfTokenTypes}.

timeline.body:
even internal type is List<Patten>
https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/blob/7d4cb0da6268d4ee7bc6ab94728b114316eefc3e/src/main/java/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/checks/metrics/AbstractClassCouplingCheck.java#L83

javadoc will have real type of setter, in during xdoc generation we will do some extra javadoc line to provide `Validation Type is {@code Pattern[]}` probably.

replies.bodyText: Should we provide Validation Type also in metadata generation?
